text.text:
Our experience with this hotel was exceptionally disappointing. Initially, the manager was courteous and made numerous assurances about the quality of the rooms and services. However, these assurances turned out to be mere empty promises. Upon entering our assigned room, we were appalled to find it unclean, with a persistently unpleasant odor emanating from the bathroom.

Adding insult to injury, the hotel had the audacity to charge for basic amenities like a toothpaste and brush kit, and provided only one bath towel for a room meant for two occupants. When we requested an additional towel, we were informed that it would come at an additional cost. The inefficiency of the lone staff member responsible for room service further exacerbated our dissatisfaction, as they were consistently unavailable when needed.

To top it off, the hotel failed to fulfill their commitment to provide a wake-up call at 3:30 am, an oversight that inconvenienced us significantly. This overall experience left us thoroughly dissatisfied with the hotel's services and management.

text.text:
stayed at Taj City Centre last week for two days, and while there were some great highlights, a few things really pulled the experience down.

The Good:

The rooms were absolutely top-notch – spacious, clean, and elegantly designed with all modern amenities.

The ambience throughout the hotel was excellent – luxurious, peaceful, and well-maintained. Perfect for a relaxing getaway or a business stay.

The Not-So-Good:

Unfortunately, the service was a major letdown. From delayed room service to lack of coordination at the front desk, the hospitality didn’t match the Taj brand standard I expected. Requests took too long to be addressed, and overall staff attentiveness was poor.

Overall:
The property and rooms are fantastic, but the pathetic service experience really needs improvement. With better hospitality, this could easily be a 5-star stay.

text.text:
We stayed at Taj New Town, Rajarhat for 3 nights in August with family, expecting a premium Taj experience. Unfortunately, while a few aspects impressed us, much of our stay was let down by poor food quality and service issues.

What worked well:

The rooms were spacious, well-appointed, and very comfortable — perfect for a family stay.

Location is convenient, with quick and easy access to the airport.

A special mention to the security staff — we accidentally left a phone behind, and they went out of their way to locate and return it. That was truly appreciated.

What went wrong:

Breakfast: Disappointing for a 5-star property — repetitive options with little variety, and the coffee was consistently bad.

In-room dining: Very poor experience. Despite clearly requesting non-spicy food (for health and family preference), dishes arrived overly spicy.

On our last night, dinner took over 2 hours to be delivered to the room — completely unacceptable for any hotel, let alone a Taj property. When it did arrive, the food quality and taste were far below expectations, especially given the premium prices.

Overall, service felt slow, uncoordinated, and not at the standard one associates with the Taj brand.

We chose Taj for its reputation of hospitality and excellence, but the food and service left us disappointed. While the rooms and location were great, the overall experience did not justify the price we paid. Taj needs to seriously address its F&B and in-room dining operations at this property.

text.text:
"Luxury Redefined at Taj City Centre, Newtown!"

From the moment you step into Taj City Centre, Newtown, you're enveloped in an ambience that whispers elegance and calm. The architecture is grand yet inviting—minimalistic, modern, and tastefully regal. The rooms are a dream—especially the ones with a private jacuzzi. Soaking in the warm bubbles while city lights twinkle outside is pure bliss.

The hospitality is classic Taj—effortless, warm, and attentive without being intrusive. The staff makes you feel seen and cared for, turning every stay into a memorable escape. Dining here is a gourmet journey—whether it’s the lavish breakfast spread or the refined dinner menu, each dish is served with flavour and finesse.

And the swimming pool? An oasis in itself. Surrounded by greens and silence, it’s perfect for both a quiet morning dip or a golden-hour unwind.

Taj City Centre, Newtown isn’t just a place to stay—it’s where luxury lives and breathes. Highly recommended for anyone seeking a five-star retreat that soothes the soul and spoils the senses.

I had a very disappointing experience at this hotel. The staff was unresponsive and unhelpful throughout my stay. Basic services like room cleaning, towel replacement, and even hot water were delayed or unavailable.

I would strongly advise others to double-check all charges and avoid this hotel if you’re expecting transparent service and respectful treatment. Definitely not worth the money.

To make matters worse, I was charged extra at checkout for services I never used. No clear explanation was provided, and the reception was rude when I asked for details. This kind of dishonest billing is unacceptable and unprofessional.

I would strongly advise others to double-check all charges and avoid this hotel if you’re expecting transparent service and respectful treatment. Definitely not worth the money.

text.text:
Title: A Great Stay with Room for Improvement

Zone by the Park Hotel in Kolkata offers a truly pleasant experience that makes it a strong contender for a top-tier hotel in the city. The staff were attentive and professional, the location is convenient, and the overall design of the common areas is modern and inviting. The restaurant and bar facilities are excellent, providing a great atmosphere to relax and unwind.

However, the reason for the 4-star rating, and not a perfect 5, is a noticeable lack of maintenance in some key areas. There were a few instances where simple upkeep seemed to have been overlooked, such as minor scuffs on the walls, a flickering light in the bathroom. These are small details, but they detract from what would otherwise be a flawless stay.

This is still a hotel I would highly recommend, but with a bit more attention to these maintenance issues, it could easily be one of the best in the area.

text.text:
I had a very disappointing experience with this hotel during my recent trip for a critical early morning US visa interview.

I had informed the hotel via WhatsApp that my flight was delayed and I would be arriving late—around midnight or early morning hours. I did get a response assuring me that the staff would be informed and I could check in anytime. Unfortunately, the reality was completely different.

I arrived at the hotel around 2:00 AM, only to find the main gate locked. I had to search for an alternate entrance and ended up waking a security guard who appeared to be fully intoxicated. The hotel itself was located on the third floor of a residential building and the main door was locked with iron grills.

Despite having two contact numbers listed on MakeMyTrip, nobody answered my calls, even after trying continuously for 15 minutes. I then reached out to MakeMyTrip customer support, who also tried for another 30 minutes, only to inform me they couldn’t help with the situation.

By the time I gave up, it was already 3:15 AM. I was stranded on the streets, exhausted, with no access to transport or alternative accommodation.

This experience was extremely distressing and unacceptable, especially considering I had booked and confirmed my stay in advance and had clearly communicated my late arrival. I sincerely hope the hotel takes serious note of this issue and ensures no future guest goes through a similar ordeal.

text.text:
The Lindsay is one of the nicest hotels I have ever visited. The hotel is located in the bustling New Market neighbourhood, which has a lot of street vendors and eateries. The hotel has easy access to Kolkata's main attractions. The gracious courteousness of the hotel staff, even the security guards, amazed us. We are grateful to Mr. Vishal Shaw, who assisted us in organising our itinerary in addition to assisting us with taxi reservations. The hotel also serves good food and have a vast breakfast menu and it was delicious too. The bed linen and the washroom was clean and hygienic.
Above all, the behaviour of hotel staff is very appreciative. We will undoubtedly recommend this hotel to our friends and relatives.

text.text:
I rarely write reviews, but this experience was so overwhelmingly negative that I feel compelled to share the full extent of my frustration. To say I was disappointed would be a monumental understatement. This establishment has deteriorated beyond recognition. What was once a place I could recommend without hesitation has now become a place I wouldn’t suggest even to my worst enemy.

Let me start with the staff – and I use the term “staff” very loosely here, because what we encountered was a group of individuals who seem to have been trained in the art of maximum rudeness. They were VERY RUDE. VERY VERY VERY VERY RUDE. I cannot stress this enough. From the moment we walked in, it felt like we were a burden rather than guests. No greeting, no smile, no courtesy – just dismissive glares and snappy, condescending tones. Any simple request was met with eye rolls or outright ignoring us. It's one thing to be understaffed or busy, but it's an entirely different and unacceptable thing to treat paying customers with open hostility.

But sadly, the staff was just the beginning of the problem.

The overall quality of the experience has dropped off a cliff. Everything – and I mean EVERYTHING – has gone downhill. The atmosphere feels neglected, the cleanliness is questionable at best, and there’s a pervasive sense that no one cares anymore. What happened to the standards? What happened to pride in service?

Even something as simple as the welcome drinks, which used to be a lovely touch, has now become a joke. The variety has decreased dramatically – once a small but delightful detail that made the experience feel special, now reduced to bland, watered-down offerings that feel like an afterthought. What used to be five or six flavorful options has now been cut down to maybe two, and neither of them were palatable.

It honestly feels like management has completely given up. It’s as if they think no one will notice the decline, or worse – that no one cares. But I noticed. I cared. And I walked away from this visit feeling cheated, unwelcome, and genuinely upset that I spent my time and money here.

I visited Calcutta Bungalow to dine at Lunchtime. The ambience was good, the place is compact so not much space for a large group of people.
Food was good and tasty 😋, but service is not good. Less staff to manage the place.

I want to share my experience: we ordered a starter and Main course at the same time. so Food came one by one, but something was missed, like Plates came 10 min after food was served at the table. So we have to eat cold food. No staff nearby to order the next food items, so we waited for the staff to visit us. Too much of a delay in services in this place.
So if you have ample time then visit this place.

text.text:
Went to the restaurant part of the Calcutta Bungalow. Awesome experience! The only feedback I would give that they can make the menu in a more streamlined way like sometimes it felt very confusing like the arrangement of the menu is not done right and like we ordered from a-la-carte, don't know about thalis. But in a-la-carte many dishes were missing and Bengali and some other cuisines were jumbled up.

Quantity vs Price is also a concern like the portion sizes felt a bit small compared to the price.

These are the reasons why I gave one star less.

But but but, I recommend all to try the unique dishes. Like unlike traditional dishes I would recommend to go for the exclusive dishes which they have made like themselves. Because we tried traditional aloo dum and luchi it was mid but when we ordered the chingri pulao and the mutton egg bake - Oh my god! Like literally those were too good! Especially my personal recommendation will be the mutton egg bake, that's so flavourful and quantity, quality of the meat and overall it's just wonderful. If any day I again go to this restaurant, I am going to order this bake! It's that GOOD!

Service I would say the staff were amazing, friendly and behaviour was good. And ambience also 10 on 10.

Overall, loved this place.

text.text: On a very fine evening we planned and visited Calcutta Bunglow for refreshments after a tiring lab schedule.  It was summer and we tried mocktails first. Tetuler moshla  sorbot, gondhoraj ghol,  aam er moshla lassi- three were so refreshing. Then we tried sandwiches,  cheesy chicken fritters, lonka achar fish nuggets . The tasty was really good.  The ambience was too good. There are floors with different sitting arrangements.  It is actually Majumdar's mansion, the heritage of old kolkata is the main attraction.  The feeling of having snacks in a mansion is amazing.  The service was prompt and the total experience is very pleasant.  Mostly recommended.

text.text:
I recently stayed at Hotel Hamza International and overall, my experience was positive. The location of the hotel is great and the facilities are well-maintained. However, my experience with the hotel management left a lot to be desired.

Upon arrival, I was informed that my online booking was denied and that I would have to pay a much higher price for a different room. This left me feeling frustrated and taken advantage of. It seems that the hotel management are running a scam by denying online bookings and then charging inflated prices at the time of check-in.

While the hotel itself is decent, I would caution others to be wary of their booking process and to double check their reservation with the hotel directly. This lack of transparency and honesty from the hotel management is disappointing and puts a damper on an otherwise pleasant stay.

I would recommend Hotel Hamza International to potential guests, but with a warning to be cautious when it comes to booking and dealing with the hotel management.

text.text:
Our experience with this hotel was exceptionally disappointing. Initially, the manager was courteous and made numerous assurances about the quality of the rooms and services. However, these assurances turned out to be mere empty promises. Upon entering our assigned room, we were appalled to find it unclean, with a persistently unpleasant odor emanating from the bathroom.

Adding insult to injury, the hotel had the audacity to charge for basic amenities like a toothpaste and brush kit, and provided only one bath towel for a room meant for two occupants. When we requested an additional towel, we were informed that it would come at an additional cost. The inefficiency of the lone staff member responsible for room service further exacerbated our dissatisfaction, as they were consistently unavailable when needed.

To top it off, the hotel failed to fulfill their commitment to provide a wake-up call at 3:30 am, an oversight that inconvenienced us significantly. This overall experience left us thoroughly dissatisfied with the hotel's services and management.

When we requested an additional towel, we were informed that it would come at an additional cost. The inefficiency of the lone staff member responsible for room service further exacerbated our dissatisfaction, as they were consistently unavailable when needed.

To top it off, the hotel failed to fulfill their commitment to provide a wake-up call at 3:30 am, an oversight that inconvenienced us significantly. This overall experience left us thoroughly dissatisfied with the hotel's services and management.

Highly recommend Hotel Royal Crowne for anyone looking for comfort, cleanliness, and top-notch service near Kolkata Airport. I’ll definitely return on my next visit!

text.text: From the hospitality of the staff to the food served at the restaurants and the lengths the staff went to accomodate us was simply one of the best experience I have had in a hotel so far. The staffs are highly professional, accommodating and courteous. The shamiyana restaurant serves lip smacking fine dining authentic bengali food. The thali is a must try and well curated. The breakfast buffet is also served in shamiyana during which flute is played live everyday and it's such a clam, serene experience. The rooms are well maintained and spacious. A big shout out to Aditya who made our stay extra special by clicking our photo with the staff of taj and then going to the lengths of framing that picture with a taj frame. It was a very thoughtful present from him. He took care of everything we asked for during our stay and made our stay very comfortable. The staff even asked us to light diya's at the foyer which is like their tradition and it was a great experience for us.

text.text:
The hotel is situated in a fantastic location, surrounded by serene roads perfect for leisurely walks. It's in a posh area, with amenities like the court and SBI office just around the corner. What's more, within a stone's throw away, you can enjoy a boat ride across the Hooghly River, with ticket counters conveniently nearby.

The top restaurant offers a peaceful evening with a scenic water view, and the food served is not only delicious but also adds to the delightful experience. The unique touch of all the waiters dressed like sailors and the manager in a captain's attire, along with ship-themed decor, creates an immersive ambiance.

Connected to the main hotel by a mini-bridge over a trench surrounded by water, the hotel offers stunning views from every angle, even from the comfort of your room. If you prefer a balcony, they can accommodate that too, allowing you to soak in the picturesque surroundings.

With both food and liquor served, guests can enjoy a complete dining experience. Plus, the hotel's proximity to iconic landmarks like Victoria Memorial and cathedrals makes it an ideal base for exploring the city.

The hotel's own lawn space for parking, complete with a railway line crossing nearby, adds to the unique charm of the place. Whether you're looking for relaxation, adventure, or both, this hotel offers an unforgettable experience in every way.

text.text:
We stayed at Polo Floatel, Kolkata from 28th July to 7th August, and those 11 days were nothing short of amazing. From the moment we stepped in and were welcomed with a refreshing drink, we knew we were in for something special.🍹

We had booked the river view cabin, and waking up to the Hooghly river flowing peacefully outside our window was like a dream. Watching sunsets from the room, seeing ships cruise by became our favourite part of each day.Every morning began with their lavish breakfast buffet ,a delicious spread with something for everyone. And beyond the amenities, what made our stay truly unforgettable was the warmth and kindness of the staff. They greeted us daily with genuine smiles and thoughtful conversations, always checking in on how we were doing. 🤝

I fell sick for a day during our stay, and the care I received from the staff touched my heart. They arranged customised meals, ensured room service was prompt, and kept checking in on my recovery. I’m deeply thankful to Mr. Akash, who even went to the market to get me medicine and fruits,his kindness meant a lot. Special thanks to Mr. Roshan, the manager, who was always there to guide us about Kolkata, help us plan our days, and made sure our stay was smooth. Mr. Dharmendra and Mr. Soumen from the restaurant was equally wonderful,always ensured the food and service exceeded our expectations.🤍

When it was time to check out, it truly felt like we were leaving a piece of our heart behind. The staff told us they’d miss us, and we absolutely felt the same. It was emotional, saying goodbye after building such sweet memories and bonds over those days. Thank you, Polo Floatel, for making our stay so special. Your hospitality, warmth, and the beautiful experience you gave us will stay with us forever. We hope to return soon! 🫶🏻

text.text:
Zone by The Park in Kolkata is a modern and stylish hotel located in the heart of the city, offering contemporary accommodations and vibrant amenities for travelers seeking a dynamic stay experience. Situated in the bustling Park Street area, it provides convenient access to Kolkata's major attractions, shopping centers, and business districts.

The hotel's design ethos reflects a bold and energetic vibe, with sleek interiors, vibrant colors, and innovative spaces that create a welcoming ambiance for guests. The rooms and suites are thoughtfully designed, featuring modern amenities such as high-speed internet, flat-screen TVs, cozy bedding, and work desks to ensure a comfortable and productive stay.

Dining at Zone by The Park Kolkata is a culinary delight, with multiple trendy restaurants and bars offering a diverse range of cuisines and experiences. Whether you're craving traditional Bengali fare, international favorites, or innovative cocktails, there's something to suit every palate and mood.

In addition to its dining options, the hotel boasts a range of recreational facilities designed to help guests unwind and recharge. These include a fitness center equipped with state-of-the-art equipment, a swimming pool for relaxation, and a rejuvenating spa offering a variety of wellness treatments.

Zone by The Park Kolkata also caters to business travelers, with well-equipped meeting and event spaces ideal for conferences, seminars, and social gatherings. The hotel's business center provides all the necessary amenities and services to ensure a successful and productive event.

Overall, Zone by The Park Kolkata offers a vibrant and dynamic stay experience that combines modern comforts, personalized service, and a central location, making it an ideal choice for both business and leisure travelers visiting the city.

I recently had the pleasure of staying at Zone by The Park, Kolkata, and it was an absolutely fantastic experience! From the moment I arrived, the hospitality was top-notch. The hotel itself is modern, well-maintained, and offers a vibrant atmosphere that truly stands out.

A special mention to Vikili and Priyanka at the Front Office—both were exceptionally welcoming, always ready to help with a warm smile, and went above and beyond to ensure a seamless stay. Their professionalism and dedication added a personal touch that made all the difference.

text.text:
Title: A Great Stay with Room for Improvement

Zone by the Park Hotel in Kolkata offers a truly pleasant experience that makes it a strong contender for a top-tier hotel in the city. The staff were attentive and professional, the location is convenient, and the overall design of the common areas is modern and inviting. The restaurant and bar facilities are excellent, providing a great atmosphere to relax and unwind.

However, the reason for the 4-star rating, and not a perfect 5, is a noticeable lack of maintenance in some key areas. There were a few instances where simple upkeep seemed to have been overlooked, such as minor scuffs on the walls, a flickering light in the bathroom. These are small details, but they detract from what would otherwise be a flawless stay.

This is still a hotel I would highly recommend, but with a bit more attention to these maintenance issues, it could easily be one of the best in the area.

text.text:
Certainly, here's an expanded version of your statement:

When it comes to accommodations stretching between Maidan and Chadni in Central Kolkata, I am inclined to believe that I've stumbled upon the finest establishment. The maintenance and care invested in this hotel are nothing short of remarkable, setting it apart from anything I've encountered before.

The moment you step into the premises, it becomes evident that no stone has been left unturned to ensure a seamless and pleasurable stay. From the impeccably clean corridors to the well-appointed rooms, every inch of the hotel exudes a sense of precision and attention to detail. It's an experience that leaves an indelible mark, creating a lasting impression of what true hospitality should encompass.

Speaking of the rooms, they deserve a special mention. The level of maintenance observed here is unparalleled. It's almost as if the room has been designed to anticipate and cater to every possible guest need. The furnishings are not only aesthetically pleasing but also incredibly comfortable. The meticulous arrangement of amenities showcases a thoughtful understanding of what guests might require during their stay. The synergy between design, functionality, and comfort is achieved to an extent that is seldom seen.

While the rooms and overall maintenance set this hotel on a pedestal, it's important to address the dining aspect as well. The food quality stands at an acceptable level—neither spectacular nor disappointing. A well-rounded menu caters to various tastes, offering a selection that is likely to satisfy most palates. The 👌 sign aptly summarizes the quality—good enough without reaching the heights of culinary excellence. For many, this might suffice, especially considering the other strengths the hotel possesses.

In terms of location, it boasts a favorable position. Situated between Maidan and Chadni, it's well-positioned for those who wish to explore the heart of Kolkata. The convenience of accessing major points of interest in this vibrant city is undoubtedly a plus. However, it's worth noting that while the exterior location has its advantages, the interior ambiance is where the hotel truly shines.

Stepping inside this establishment is akin to entering a realm of serenity and comfort. The bustling city outside seems to fade away, replaced by a sense of tranquility and a soothing atmosphere. This internal oasis is where the hotel crafts its true identity. The inviting lobby, the hushed corridors, and the cocooned rooms combine to provide a haven from the outside world. It's an oasis of calm where guests can retreat after a day of exploration.

In conclusion, the assertion that this is the best hotel between Maidan and Chadni in Central Kolkata appears to be well-founded. The meticulous attention to maintenance and the immaculate rooms set it apart as a gem in the hospitality landscape. While the food quality may not steal the show, it satisfactorily caters to hunger pangs. The location itself, though convenient, pales in comparison to the sanctuary-like ambiance that greets you upon entering. For anyone seeking a respite from the city's hustle and bustle without compromising on convenience, this hotel stands as an excellent choice—a testament to the fusion of comfort, aesthetics, and thoughtful design.

The location itself, though convenient, pales in comparison to the sanctuary-like ambiance that greets you upon entering. For anyone seeking a respite from the city's hustle and bustle without compromising on convenience, this hotel stands as an excellent choice—a testament to the fusion of comfort, aesthetics, and thoughtful design.

Beautifully Decorated Stage: The stage at Green INN was a true highlight. It was beautifully adorned, adding grandeur to the entire event and leaving a lasting impression.

Delicious Food: The catering team at Green INN delivered not only visually appealing but also incredibly delicious food, satisfying every palate.

Polite Staff Behavior: The hotel staff exhibited exceptional professionalism, politeness, and attentiveness throughout the event, ensuring every guest felt well taken care of.

Supportive and Helpful Owner and Manager: The owner and manager of Green INN provided invaluable support and assistance from start to finish, making us feel confident in their capable hands.

In conclusion, Green INN surpassed our expectations for our reception event. The venue decoration was stunning, the stage was beautifully decorated, and the food was delicious. The polite staff and supportive owner and manager added to the overall positive experience. We highly recommend Green INN for any special event

text.text:
If I go to explain all the experiences I got from this hotel, then it will be quite lengthy, so I will explain it in a straight and simple way.🤗

Good hotel rooms in this area are quite expensive, so at a cheap price point you can always get these kinds of rooms. So, at a low price point, the room quality is OK.🙂

The location is really good.👍

Finally, the staff's behaviour, I am truly shocked. I never expected to find this level of service in this hotel. Actually, they are really polite, friendly, and helpful. This is the main reason why I am reviewing this hotel.🥰❤️

If you have a limited budget and you have to stay in this area, then you may choose this hotel. Because you can easily manage one night.😌

📌Note: I had to choose this hotel because of the IPL match. At around 12:30 (night) the match was over, and at that time I was not able to go home (outside Kolkata), so I needed to stay near somewhere for that night.

text.text:
This place is the definition of chic. The interiors are so elite and clean, it gives you a luxury feel. The vintage collection in the common area has a very personal touch added to it. The wooden clocks and the newspaper stand grab your attention right away. The rooms are so cosy and the one I stayed in had an open view which was so calming. The rooms are well equipped with vintage lampshades. The beds are well cleaned and comfortable for one to sleep like a baby.

Coming to the staff, you will never not see a smile on their faces. They treat you like you want to be treated on a vacation, always ready at your service. The breakfast options were really good and the best thing is they in fact serve it on time if mentioned before.

The place is located in the heart of Park Street with gazillions of places to eat and shop. One would assume that it would have skyrocketing prices but believe me when I say this, the pricing is extremely pocket friendly, especially if you plan to stay with your family.

All in all, it was beautiful and serene. I would go back and stay at the same place anyday whenever I visit again.

This hotel is a hidden gem.

Location: Its located just beside Peter Cat and behind Flurys. The entrance is beside Carpe Diem and Burma Tea House. So easy to locate and smack in the middle of Kolkata's most happening place.

Rooms: Rooms are well maintained, clean and modern. Yet the hotel management has succesfully retained a few elements that make you want to view the hotel through a slightly sepia tinted lens.

Staff: Extremely polite and professional.

I am definitely going to stay here again. So very cool and convenient!

Now I have been regular to this property. Prime Location, Clean Room, Excellent food and room service is quick. Room size is big with big toilet and shower area. I feels like home.

I highly recommend.

Thank your Mr. Goenka Sir and Windsor Suites.

text.text:
Stayed for 09 nights.
Pros:
1) location: the hotel is located right across the new market. All the shopping streets are in walking distances.
2) housekeeping: the staff are friendly and clean the room immaculately. We never had to call them to clean up the room.
Cons:
1) location: due to the location on the busiest streets in Kolkata, taxis aren’t always readily available. And moreover drop offs are painful as the road becomes one way traffic, passengers are dropped off two minutes walk away from the hotel every time. Bad thing for elders and patients.
2) noise: street facing rooms are loud and noisy.
3) breakfast: the breakfast is below average. Quantity and quality wise.

text.text: Amazing experience at Calcutta Bungalow. Its very difficult to find a hotel with such a positive vibe in this metropolitan and Calcutta Bungalow has exceeded all of our expectations with its breathtaking decor and the outstanding hospitality provided by each and every staff member.

originalText.text: Amazing experience at Calcutta Bungalow. Its very difficult to find a hotel with such a positive vibe in this metropolitan and Calcutta Bungalow has exceeded all of our expectations with its breathtaking decor and the outstanding hospitality provided by each and every staff member.

text.text:
Calcutta Bungalow is a wonderful place to call home when visiting Kolkata! We stayed 5 nights and would go back in a heartbeat. The restoration of this historic structure into a boutique hotel with six beautiful and unique rooms is amazing. From the street entrance, through the lobby, into the rooms, and all the way up to the rooftop restaurant, everything is colorful, vibrant, and beautiful!

The food served for breakfast to all hotel guests is delicious, as was the thali we had for our evening meal on the last night.

The staff is beyond helpful!

Many thanks to all of you for making us feel so welcome and for tending to our every need!

text.text: Well the aura of the place is magical. You will definitely feel that you are in old Calcutta and the ambiànce is very gorgeous and close to nature. I loved everything about the place from the idea of having specific heritage themed rooms to the kullad style water bottles to smiling bright sunflowers on the rooftop to the gallery of beautiful plants to the pretty chandeliers and not to miss the breakfast space. Everything is luxurious yet so simple. The experience is worth every penny that you spend. And the saviour- Wasim. He is that one face which I can never forget. A smiling hardworking guy always ready to help you at anytime of the day. He just exceeded my expectation and made my experience a memorable one. He will be out there telling you stories about the place and also making sure that you are comfortable in your room and have everything that you require. Thanks a ton Wasim for making my stay so beautiful. Hope to see you soon!!

text.text: Calcutta Bungalow Restaurant offers a delightful culinary journey through traditional Bengali flavors. The charming ambiance, with its vintage decor, transports you to old-world Kolkata, creating an authentic dining experience. The menu features a variety of mouthwatering dishes. The staff is attentive and knowledgeable, ensuring excellent service. The portions are generous, and the prices are reasonable, making it a perfect spot for family gatherings or intimate meals. Overall, Calcutta Bungalow is a must-visit for anyone craving an authentic Bengali dining experience.

text.text: WORST EXPERIENCE. Everything was broken inside the room like walls lamps switches etc. Staff was okay but the manager's behaviour was the worst. I booked for rs. 900 something through agoda and by the time of check-in that manager in the front desk said they don't have a tie up with Agoda. They charged me a "discounted rate" of 1800Rs. In that price range go for 'Kzar corporate hotel'. In short PLEASE DON'T GO.
